steps: Everyone closes their eyes except the impostor(s)

Everyone opens their eyes and discusses who might be the impostor
Vote to eliminate someone you think is the impostor
The person with the most votes is eliminated
Repeat until all impostors are found or they outnumber the innocents

hero.title: Tips & Strategies
hero.subtitle: Level up your Impostor gameplay with expert strategies for both innocents and impostors. Learn psychological tricks, advanced tactics, and winning plays.

forInnocents.title: Strategies for Innocents
forInnocents.intro: As an innocent, your goal is to identify and eliminate impostors through careful observation and deduction.

tips.title: Ask Specific Questions
tips.description: Don't ask generic questions. Target specific players with detailed questions about their actions, observations, or reasoning. Impostors often struggle with specific details.

tips.title: Watch for Behavioral Patterns
tips.description: Notice who speaks first, who stays quiet, who deflects blame. Impostors often display nervous behaviors like over-explaining or avoiding eye contact.

tips.title: Track Voting Patterns
tips.description: Pay attention to who votes for whom. Impostors may vote together or strategically vote for innocents to create chaos.

tips.title: Build Alliances Carefully
tips.description: Team up with players you trust, but don't trust too quickly. Impostors love to gain trust early.

tips.title: Don't Reveal Everything
tips.description: Hold back some observations. If an impostor knows what you know, they can craft better lies.

forImpostors.title: Strategies for Impostors
forImpostors.intro: As an impostor, blend in, deflect suspicion, and strategically eliminate threats without getting caught.

tips.title: Act Natural
tips.description: Don't overact innocence or be overly defensive. Mirror the behavior of actual innocents - confused, questioning, and analytical.

tips.title: Create Reasonable Doubt
tips.description: Don't try to completely prove your innocence. Just create enough doubt to shift suspicion to others.

tips.title: Accuse Strategically
tips.description: Occasionally accuse other players (including fellow impostors) to appear engaged. But don't be too aggressive or you'll draw attention.

tips.title: Control the Narrative
tips.description: Guide discussions subtly. Ask leading questions that direct suspicion elsewhere. Frame debates in ways that benefit you.

tips.title: Vote with the Crowd
tips.description: Unless coordinating with other impostors, vote with the majority. Standing out with unusual votes raises suspicion.

tips.title: Use Social Pressure
tips.description: Players hate being the odd one out. Use this to your advantage whether you're innocent trying to build consensus or impostor deflecting blame.

tips.title: Create Time Pressure
tips.description: When discussions drag, players make hasty decisions. As impostor, you can benefit from rushed votes.

tips.title: Exploit Confirmation Bias
tips.description: People believe what confirms their existing beliefs. Plant seeds early that grow into strong suspicions later.

commonScenarios.title: Common Scenarios & How to Handle Them

scenarios.title: You're Accused as Innocent
scenarios.description: Stay calm and provide specific details about your observations. Don't get defensive. Ask your accuser for their reasoning and poke holes in it.

scenarios.title: You're Accused as Impostor
scenarios.description: Don't panic. Calmly deny and redirect by questioning the accuser's motives or suggesting alternative suspects with reasonable arguments.

scenarios.title: Two Players Accusing Each Other
scenarios.description: As innocent, analyze both arguments objectively. As impostor, support whichever narrative helps you most.

scenarios.title: Final Rounds (3-4 Players Left)
scenarios.description: Critical thinking time. As innocent, trust your instincts. As impostor, you may need bold moves.

items: One device with Cluso app installed

impostor.name: Impostors
impostor.description: 1-4 players (depending on group size) who know each other's identities. Their goal is to avoid detection and outnumber the innocents.

innocent.name: Innocents
innocent.description: All remaining players who don't know anyone's role. Their goal is to identify and eliminate all impostors through discussion and voting.

phases.title: 1. Role Assignment Phase
phases.description: Pass the device around. Each player secretly views their role. Impostors will see who the other impostors are. Innocents see only that they are innocent.

phases.title: 2. Eyes Closed Phase
phases.description: Everyone closes their eyes. Impostors open their eyes to acknowledge each other, then close them again. This ensures impostors know their allies.

phases.title: 3. Discussion Phase
phases.description: Everyone opens their eyes and discusses freely. Players ask questions, share observations, and try to deduce who the impostors might be. Set a time limit (3-5 minutes recommended).

phases.title: 4. Voting Phase
phases.description: Players vote to eliminate someone they suspect is an impostor. The person with the most votes is eliminated and their role is revealed. Ties can be handled by revote or no elimination.

phases.title: 5. Check Win Conditions
phases.description: If all impostors are eliminated, innocents win. If impostors equal or outnumber innocents, impostors win. Otherwise, return to Discussion Phase.

innocent.title: Innocents Win When:
conditions: All impostors have been eliminated through voting
This must happen before impostors reach equal numbers with innocents

impostor.title: Impostors Win When:
conditions: Impostors equal or outnumber the remaining innocents
At this point, impostors can't be outvoted and have won

list.title: Speed Round
list.description: Limit discussion time to 2 minutes per round for a fast-paced, chaotic game.

list.title: Silent Impostors
list.description: Impostors cannot see each other and must work independently to avoid detection.

list.title: Detective Mode
list.description: One innocent is secretly designated as a detective who gets one chance to learn if a player is an impostor.

list.title: Double Elimination
list.description: Vote to eliminate two players each round for a faster, more intense game.

mistakes.title: Voting Too Quickly
mistakes.description: Take time to discuss and gather information. Random voting helps impostors win.

mistakes.title: Ignoring Quiet Players
mistakes.description: Impostors often stay quiet to avoid suspicion. Engage everyone in the discussion.

mistakes.title: Revealing Information Too Early
mistakes.description: As an innocent, don't reveal all your observations immediately. Save information for strategic moments.

mistakes.title: Overacting as Impostor
mistakes.description: Impostors who act too suspicious or too innocent can draw attention. Stay natural.

howManyImpostors.q: How many impostors should there be?
howManyImpostors.a: For 3-5 players: 1 impostor. For 6-9 players: 2 impostors. For 10-15 players: 3 impostors. For 16+ players: 4 impostors. You can adjust based on difficulty preference.

canSkipVote.a: Yes, but it's not recommended. Skipping votes makes it harder for innocents to win. However, skipping can be strategic if there's not enough information.

whatIfTie.q: What happens if there's a tie in voting?
whatIfTie.a: You can either: (1) Have a revote between tied players only, (2) No one is eliminated that round, or (3) Eliminate all tied players. Decide on your house rule before starting.

canDiscussAfterElimination.a: No. Once eliminated, players should remain silent and not influence the game. They can watch but not participate in discussions.
